metadata.Title: CVE-2013-6412 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The transform_save function in transform.c in Augeas 1.0.0 through 1.1.0 does not properly calculate the permission values when the umask contains a "7," which causes world-writable permissions to be used for new files and allows local users to modify the files via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-6412` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

augeas-lenses - 1.2.0-0ubuntu1.1
augeas-tools - 1.2.0-0ubuntu1.1
libaugeas0 - 1.2.0-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> This is due to an incomplete fix for CVE-2012-0786.

criterions.comment: augeas package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.0-0ubuntu1.1').
